author: Staff Reporter
text:
Brigade Group and GIC, Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund, have jointly acquired a 16-acre land parcel at Perungudi, in which a World Trade Center (WTC) and residential units, entailing an investment of more than Rs. 1,000 crore, are expected to come up. The land was purchased from Kansai Nerolac Paints for Rs. 537.86 crore.

The acquisition was done through Perungudi Real Estates, a special purpose vehicle formed by Brigade Enterprises and GIC. Real Estate firm Jones Lang Lasalle (JLL) was also instrumental in this deal. “The Brigade Group has licences to build World Trade Centers. This is the third WTC for us after Bengaluru and Cochin,” said a senior official from Brigade Enterprises. — Staff Reporter
title: World Trade Center planned in Perungudi
